## Gene Details:
- **Gene ID:** [AT3G49500](https://www.arabidopsis.org/locus?name=AT3G49500)
- **Gene Symbol:** <u>AtRDR6, RDR6, SDE1, SGS2</u>
- **Gene Name:** RNA-dependent RNA polymerase 6, SILENCING DEFECTIVE 1, SUPPRESSOR OF GENE SILENCING 2
- **Description:**   RNA-dependent RNA polymerase 6;(source:Araport11)
- **TAIR Accession:** locus:2114633
- **Genome:** [Araport11_genome_release](https://www.arabidopsis.org/download/list?dir=Genes%2FAraport11_genome_release)
- **Species:** *Arabidopsis thaliana*

## Germplasm Phenotype:
   - [CS16276]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;No visible plant phenotype.
   - [CS24285]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;A proportion of pre-meiotic ovules have two MMCs and have several abnormally enlarged sub-epidermal cells. Post-meiotic ovules showed two independently developing  female gametophytes at a frequency of 43.3% 
   - [CS24285]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Mutant plants express adult vegetative traits precociously; their vegetative phenotype is most apparent around 10-14 days after germination, when the first two leaves appear more strongly down-rolled than normal; mutant plants display variable seed set under some conditions, and also produce stigmatic tissue at the tip of the septum; defective in PTGS of sense transgenes.
   - [CS24286]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Mutant plants express adult vegetative traits precociously; their vegetative phenotype is most apparent around 10-14 days after germination, when the first two leaves appear more strongly down-rolled than normal; mutant plants display variable seed set under some conditions, and also produce stigmatic tissue at the tip of the septum; defective in PTGS of sense transgenes.
   - [CS24287]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Mutant plants express adult vegetative traits precociously; their vegetative phenotype is most apparent around 10-14 days after germination, when the first two leaves appear more strongly down-rolled than normal; mutant plants display variable seed set under some conditions, and also produce stigmatic tissue at the tip of the septum; defective in PTGS of sense transgenes.
   - [CS24288]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Mutant plants express adult vegetative traits precociously; their vegetative phenotype is most apparent around 10-14 days after germination, when the first two leaves appear more strongly down-rolled than normal; mutant plants display variable seed set under some conditions, and also produce stigmatic tissue at the tip of the septum; defective in PTGS of sense transgenes.
   - [CS66111]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Rosette leaves elongated and curled downwards. Early rosette leaves have higher length/width ratios than those of Col-0. Precocious production of abaxial trichomes in early rosette leaves implying accelerated vegetative phase change.
   - [CS66112]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Rosette leaves elongated and curled downwards. Early rosette leaves have higher length/width ratios than those of Col-0. Precocious production of abaxial trichomes in early rosette leaves implying accelerated vegetative phase change.
   - [CS66480]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;similar to rdr6-15; rosette leaves narrow, highly twisted, curled and irregularly shaped; flowers are sterile, sepals and petals are downwardly curled, narrow and twisted and fail to enclose all organs;  stamens are short and lack pollen and the gynoecia are irregularly shaped, swollen and frequently split open at the apical end.
   - [CS66481]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;similar to rdr6-15; rosette leaves narrow, highly twisted, curled and irregularly shaped; flowers are sterile, sepals and petals are downwardly curled, narrow and twisted and fail to enclose all organs;  stamens are short and lack pollen and the gynoecia are irregularly shaped, swollen and frequently split open at the apical end.
   - [CS66485]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;similar to rdr6-15; homozygous individuals have elongated, downwardly curled rosette leaves; early rosette leaves have higher length/width ratios than those of Col-0.
   - [CS67869]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Mutant plants express adult vegetative traits precociously; their vegetative phenotype is most apparent around 10-14 days after germination, when the first two leaves appear more strongly down-rolled than normal; mutant plants display variable seed set under some conditions, and also produce stigmatic tissue at the tip of the septum
   - [CS67870]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Mutant plants express adult vegetative traits precociously; their vegetative phenotype is most apparent around 10-14 days after germination, when the first two leaves appear more strongly down-rolled than normal; mutant plants display variable seed set under some conditions, and also produce stigmatic tissue at the tip of the septum
   - [CS67871]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Mutant plants express adult vegetative traits precociously; their vegetative phenotype is most apparent around 10-14 days after germination, when the first two leaves appear more strongly down-rolled than normal; mutant plants display variable seed set under some conditions, and also produce stigmatic tissue at the tip of the septum.
   - [CS69958]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Exhibits known phenotypes of rdr6-11 (CS24285); precocious transition to adult phase of vegetative development, elongated and downward-curling leaves, stamens that frequently fail to contact the stigma resulting in variable seed sets, split septum producing ectopic stigmatic tissue, and defective posttranscriptional gene silencing of sense transgenes (Peragine et al. 2004).
   - [CS72500]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;GFP fluorescence in nuclei and plasma membrane
   - [CS72501]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;GFP fluorescence in nuclei and plasma membrane
   - [CS73407]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;narrow leaves
   - [rdr6-5]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Infection with cucumber mosaic virus (CMV) revealed an overaccumulation of CMV RNA compared to wild type.
   - [rdr6-5]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;No obvious leaf developmental defects.
   - [rdr6-5]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;TAS3 but not TAS1 or TAS2 ta-siRNAs were detected.
   - [rdr6-5 (2a3)]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Reduction in post-transcriptional gene silencing.
   - [rdr6-6 (2a3)]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Reduction in post-transcriptional gene silencing.
   - [sgs2-1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Downward-curled leaf margins.
   - [sgs2-1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Enhanced susceptibility to virus, reduction in post-transcriptional gene silencing
   - [sgs2-1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Infection with cucumber mosaic virus (CMV) revealed an overaccumulation of CMV RNA compared to wild type.
   - [sgs2-1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Reduction in post-transcriptional gene silencing.
   - [sgs2-1]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;TAS1, TAS2, and TAS3 ta-siRNAs were below detectable levels.
